intro: Senecio heterodontus, commonly known as the variable groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio heterodontus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
